solvents.name: N,N′-dimethylformamide (DMF)
solvents.amount: 500 μL of a 10mg/mL Th(NO3)4 (5.0 mg) solution and 250 μL of 2.5g/L ligand solution (0.625 mg)

synthesis_conditions.other_conditions: Vials were sealed and heated statically in an oven.

synthesis_conditions.description: Synthesized according to previously published procedures. In summary, 6-hydroxy-1-naphthoic acid was esterified using concentrated sulfuric acid in methanol, coupled using stoichiometric FeCl3.6H2O in water, and de-esterified with sodium hydroxide in water. The crude product was recrystallized in methanol and obtained with an overall yield of 60% by mass.

irradiation_conditions.source: Shepherd 60Co source at the University of Notre Dame Radiation Laboratory
irradiation_conditions.sample_preparation: Crystals of TOF-16 were degassed by a freeze-thaw technique and flame sealed in Pyrex tubes.

irradiation_conditions.source: 9S Accelerator at the University of Notre Dame Nuclear Science Laboratory
irradiation_conditions.sample_preparation: Samples were prepared by grinding TOF-16 crystals in DMF to a polycrystalline material and depositing a suspension of the polycrystalline sample in MeOH on a glass slide.

characterization_methods.details: Used to confirm the bulk purity and structural integrity of TOF-16 before and after irradiation.
Collected on single crystals of TOF-16 to probe the impact of irradiation on the structure.
Infrared spectra of crystals of TOF-16 were obtained to study the chemical stability post-irradiation.
Electronic spectra were obtained for crystalline samples of TOF-16 at room temperature to observe changes due to irradiation.
Conducted on TOF-16 to study thermal stability and decomposition.
Performed on supercritical CO2 activated TOF-16 to determine surface area and pore volume.
